headline: Verizon Resets Consumer Business As Frontier Deal And Stock Gains Collide
summary: Verizon Communications (NYSE:VZ) is undergoing a major leadership change in its core consumer division under new CEO Dan Schulman. The company is cutting 13,000 jobs and shifting nearly 180 company owned retail stores to a franchise model. Verizon has completed its acquisition of Frontier Communications, expanding its fiber footprint and business reach. For investors watching NYSE:VZ, these moves come as the shares trade at $49.46, with returns of 5.0% over the past week and 26.8% over the...
